New Records: Lionel Messi set a Copa América record by playing in his 35th match, surpassing Chile's Sergio Livingstone.
Messi extended his own record with his 18th assist in Copa América.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi's through ball led to Julián Álvarez's goal in the 49th minute.
Messi assisted on Lautaro Martínez's goal in the 88th minute.
Messi's best scoring chance was in the 65th minute, but Maxime Crépeau made a diving stop.
Messi was shaken up by a sliding tackle from Moïse Bombito in the 82nd minute but remained in the game.
Argentina goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez made a crucial save in the 43rd minute, batting away a bounced header by Stephen Eustáquio.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada coach Jesse Marsch commented on Messi's performance, stating that despite their efforts, Messi's plays were world-class.
Canada captain Alphonso Davies expressed disappointment with his team's performance, especially in the second half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Grass was installed at Mercedes-Benz Stadium after a MLS game on the usual artificial turf.
Argentina started eight players who began the 2022 World Cup final victory over France.
